Because coextinctions target different phylogenetic and functional groups and given the fact that we observe a highly significant phylogenetic signal across all functional traits ( P < 0.001 in all cases), one could conclude that the functional dendrogram ( Fig. 4B) merely depicts phylogenetic relationships ( Fig. 4A). In line with this, the effect of locality and network identity on coextinction probabilities based on functional similarity is qualitatively identical to analyses including phylogeny (tables S5 and S6). However, a cophenetic correlation ( c = 0.045, P = 0.040) and a Mantel test (Spearman r = 0.052, P = 0.029) indicate a very weak albeit significant association between these descriptors.
